title: 道德經
source: Chinese Text Project (ctext.org) - James Legge translation

passages.zh: 曲則全，枉則直，窪則盈，弊則新，少則得，多則惑。
passages.en: (The increase granted to humility) The partial becomes complete; the crooked, straight; the empty, full; the worn out, new. He whose (desires) are few gets them; he whose (desires) are many goes astray.

passages.zh: 是以聖人抱一為天下式。
passages.en: Therefore the sage holds in his embrace the one thing (of humility), and manifests it to all the world.
He is free from self-display, and therefore he shines;
from self-assertion, and therefore he is distinguished;
from self-boasting, and therefore his merit is acknowledged;
from self-complacency, and therefore he acquires superiority.

passages.zh: 夫唯不爭，故天下莫能與之爭。
passages.en: It is because he is thus free from striving that therefore no one in the world is able to strive with him.

passages.zh: 古之所謂曲則全者，豈虛言哉！
passages.en: That saying of the ancients that 'the partial becomes complete' was not vainly spoken:
all real completion is comprehended under it.
